

# Goals

- recover performance gap with s4
   - mamba2 hp tuning
   - understand mamba2 init
- dataset improvements
   - multivoice
   - audio patch encoding (to use as conditioning)


## Details

The bugfixes were simple, I think going forward I should lean more heavily on the torch audio library,since the last time I looked at it it has progressed far, partiuclarly the mu-law encoding looks much better than my bitcrushing.

The Mamba2 integration was  bit more tricky, there are some tricky dependencies between causalconv1d and mamba which took a couple reinstalls to work through and still not really sure how I actually fixed the problem, will have to figure it out again next time i delete my lambda instance.

The only other gotcha is to make sure that (d_head \times expansion) / n_heads is a multiple of 8, otherwise you will get various issues

these were the issues I visited 
-  [mamba2 training speed is very very very slow · Issue #389 · state-spaces/mamba](https://github.com/state-spaces/mamba/issues/389) 
-  [On the small model, the actual GPU memory usage of Mamba2 is much higher than that of Mamba1. · Issue #439 · state-spaces/mamba](https://github.com/state-spaces/mamba/issues/439) 
- [How to load mamba1's weight to mamba2 ? · Issue #453 · state-spaces/mamba](https://github.com/state-spaces/mamba/issues/453)
-  [How to use Mamba2？ · Issue #475 · state-spaces/mamba](https://github.com/state-spaces/mamba/issues/475) [Slow Mamba 2 training speeds with higher d_state values · Issue #479 · state-spaces/mamba](https://github.com/state-spaces/mamba/issues/479) 
- [why GPU memory cost of Mamba2 Block > full self-attention block? And how to reduce this memory cost when training? · Issue #495 · state-spaces/mamba](https://github.com/state-spaces/mamba/issues/495)
 - [CUDA error when using Mamba2 with long context · Issue #503 · state-spaces/mamba](https://github.com/state-spaces/mamba/issues/503) 
- [Replace mamba1 with mamba2 and training becomes very slow! · Issue #510 · state-spaces/mamba](https://github.com/state-spaces/mamba/issues/510)
- [Loss NaN in Mamba2 · Issue #352 · state-spaces/mamba](https://github.com/state-spaces/mamba/issues/352)
- [训练时loss.backward出现问题了 · Issue #373 · state-spaces/mamba](https://github.com/state-spaces/mamba/issues/373) 
- [The simple test of the model works fine, but there is an "Aborted (core dumped)" issue during training. · Issue #375 · state-spaces/mamba](https://github.com/state-spaces/mamba/issues/375)
-  [causal-conv1d installation error · Issue #55 · state-spaces/mamba](https://github.com/state-spaces/mamba/issues/55) 
- [Import Error · Issue #169 · state-spaces/mamba](https://github.com/state-spaces/mamba/issues/169#issue-2122414656)
-  [Mamba-2 Error: `'NoneType' object has no attribute 'causal_conv1d_fwd'` · Issue #467 · state-spaces/mamba](https://github.com/state-spaces/mamba/issues/467) 
- [mamba_ssm Install Failure · Issue #481 · state-spaces/mamba](https://github.com/state-spaces/mamba/issues/481)

## Results

The bugfixes and Mamba2 integration were implemented and a model was trained using the same settings as [[s4-dx7-vc-fir-01]] but using the Mamba2 layer rather than S4

Results from this run are `exalted-flower-180`, the model from  [[s4-dx7-vc-fir-01]] is `snowy-sponge-110`

### loss 
The trainer loss looks like this (note `snowy-sponge` is truncated here and actual run went for many more steps). It is starting much higher than the S4 model but seems to be descending at a faster rate. 

the higher starting loss could have many reasons
- more difficult problem without the signal truncation bug 
- bad initialisation
	- S4 goes into extreme care to init the weights just right, not sure if the `mamba-ssm` module I'm using is handling this or if its necessary for the transformer style ssm 
- bad hyper parameters
- broken assumptions
	- in the theory it states that mamba works better for discrete domains and s4 better for continuous domains
	- imo opinion unlikely to be the reason
![[train_loss.png]]


### step time
The per step time has increased about 0.1s between the S4 and the Mamba2, I know Mamba2 is supposed to be faster than Mamba but I also think it makes sense that S4 is faster
![[step_time.png]]

### validation results

The numbers here look about right. Worse than the S4 with a worse loss.

it is interesting that the S4 is much smoother in the validation results, to me this makes me further suspicious that my current initialisation is not correct.
![[validation_plots.png]]

# ideas

- encode patch bytes into audio stream and prepend to the synthesized source audio 
   - opens possibility for multivoice
   - simple and does not require architectural changes to deal with the condtioning
   - follows effective patterns from LLMs around in context learning
   - likely not possible with S4 due to time independent computing..mamba though
   - can use FM synth as the configuration signal heh
- Train a Mamba1 variant as well
